availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky farmer. Kentucky native. Married Mary L. Rogers. Father of James R. Rogers, L. Rogers, and Alice Rogers.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 303. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 72. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Eastern Division, p. 52. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Eastern Division, p. 27. “Warren Brown Rogers (1810-1864),” Find A Grave, memorial no. 28963733, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=28963733&ref=acom (accessed July 30, 2017).
